member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event
member.summary: A JSON object representing a batch of unique event occurrences in your app.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
A collection of key-value pairs that give additional context to the event. The key-value pairs are specified by the developer.
This collection can be empty or the attribute object can be omitted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.EventType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EventType.
A name signifying an event that occurred in your app. This is used for grouping and aggregating like events together for reporting purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Metrics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metrics.
A collection of key-value pairs that gives additional, measurable context to the event. The key-value pairs are specified by the developer.
This collection can be empty or the attribute object can be omitted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Session
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Session.
The session the event occured within.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.TimestampUtc
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimestampUtc.
The time the event occurred in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
The version of the event.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Event.Timestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TimestampUtc.
This property is deprecated. Setting this property results in non-UTC DateTimes not being marshalled correctly. Use TimestampUtc instead. Setting either Timestamp or TimestampUtc results in both Timestamp and TimestampUtc being assigned, the latest assignment to either one of the two property is reflected in the value of both. Timestamp is provided for backwards compatibility only and assigning a non-Utc DateTime to it results in the wrong timestamp being passed to the service.
The time the event occurred in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutEvents operation. The PutEvents operation records one or more events. You can have up to 1,500 unique custom events per app, any combination of up to 40 attributes and metrics per custom event, and any number of attribute or metric values.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest.ClientContext
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientContext.
The client context including the client ID, app title, app version and package name.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest.ClientContextEncoding
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientContextEncoding.
The encoding used for the client context.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest.Events
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Events.
An array of Event JSON objects

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutEvents operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session
member.summary: Describes the session. Session information is required on ALL events.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.Duration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Duration.
The duration of the session.

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
A unique identifier for the session

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.StartTimestampUtc
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTimestampUtc.
The time the event started in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.StopTimestampUtc
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StopTimestampUtc.
The time the event terminated in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.StartTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTimestampUtc.
This property is deprecated. Setting this property results in non-UTC DateTimes not being marshalled correctly. Use StartTimestampUtc instead. Setting either StartTimestamp or StartTimestampUtc results in both StartTimestamp and StartTimestampUtc being assigned, the latest assignment to either one of the two property is reflected in the value of both. StartTimestamp is provided for backwards compatibility only and assigning a non-Utc DateTime to it results in the wrong timestamp being passed to the service.
The time the event started in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: P:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.Session.StopTimestamp
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StopTimestampUtc.
This property is deprecated. Setting this property results in non-UTC DateTimes not being marshalled correctly. Use StopTimestampUtc instead. Setting either StopTimestamp or StopTimestampUtc results in both StopTimestamp and StopTimestampUtc being assigned, the latest assignment to either one of the two property is reflected in the value of both. StopTimestamp is provided for backwards compatibility only and assigning a non-Utc DateTime to it results in the wrong timestamp being passed to the service.
The time the event terminated in ISO 8601 standard date time format. For example, 2014-06-30T19:07:47.885Z

member.name: T:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing MobileAnalytics
Amazon Mobile Analytics is a service for collecting, visualizing, and understanding app usage data at scale.

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.#ctor(Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsConfig)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.MobileAnalytics.AmazonMobileAnalyticsClient.PutEvents(Amazon.MobileAnalytics.Model.PutEventsRequest)
member.summary: The PutEvents operation records one or more events. You can have up to 1,500 unique custom events per app, any combination of up to 40 attributes and metrics per custom event, and any number of attribute or metric values.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutEvents service method.
member.returns: The response from the PutEvents service method, as returned by MobileAnalytics.
member.exception: An exception object returned when a request fails.

A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the PutEvents service method, as returned by MobileAnalytics.
member.exception: An exception object returned when a request fails.
